• Overview
  • Datasets

Single-nucleus alternative polyadenylation repository

Overview

This is a supplementary website for: Single-cell landscape and regulation of alternative polyadenylation in the brain

We report a single-nucleus atlas of alternative polyadenylation (APA) of the aged human brain across 2 million cells from 379 human post-mortem brains across aged individuals with and without Alzheimer’s disease (AD).

 

We also integrate APA variation with whole genome sequencing (WGS) to identify cell-type-resolved 3’UTR quantitative trait loci (3’aQTLs) for 4,288 APAs. We find that 3’aQTLs preferentially colocalize with pQTLs over eQTLs. This extends to 168 GWAS and 3’aQTL colocalized loci, of which only 17.5% are shared with eQTLs. APA provides a complementary and largely independent mechanistic layer both for understanding gene regulatory changes in disease, as well as for interpreting non-coding genetic variation in brain traits and diseases.

  • Summary analyses are currently available as supplementary tables below.
  • Analysis code for the paper can be found on github
  • RNA-seq data for the knock-down experiments for regulator validation are available at National Genomics Data Center (NGDC) under the accession HRA014304
  • In addition to resources provided below and on Synapse, the original single-cell transcriptomic dataset is available for interactive visualization through the UCSC Cell Browser, as part of the AD and Aging brain atlas

Contact: Xushen Xiong - xiongxs at zju dot edu dot cn / Carles Boix - carles_boix at hms dot harvard dot edu

Datasets

Datasets corresponding to manuscript analyses can be found here and are summarized in the table below. Processed human datasets have been deidentified to protect confidentiality - the mapping to ROSMAP IDs and complete metadata can be found on Synapse.

Dataset Files Description
Individual metadata Table (tsv) De-identified individual-level metadata from aging and AD atlas
APA definitions Table (tsv, rds) APA definitions and mean PDUI values across cell types
Individual-level APA matrices Directory with rds files Individual-level APA matrices (PDUI values) for each cell type
AD differential APAs (DAPAs) Table (tsv, xlsx) Differential APAs associated with Alzheimer’s disease status in each cell type. Genes are annotated with AD risk gene status, 3’aQTL status, and AD GWAS colocalization status
3’aQTL and eQTL summary statistics Directory with sumstat files Summary statistics for 3’aQTL and eQTL mapping in each cell type
Genetically regulated APAs Tables (tsv, xlsx) Merged table of all APA sites with genetic regulation (g-APA) in each cell type, identified through 3’aQTL mapping

Complete human raw data were released as part of the AD and Aging brain atlas in collaboration with ROSMAP through Synapse (syn52293442). The data and human metadata must be accessed through Synapse with a Data Use Certificate (DUC). Human metadata can be found at Synapse (syn3157322) or can be requested through the RADC Hub.
